title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor and the user tries to open it in another editor, nothing happens.
EB: However, there should be a warning message displayed, informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Make sure you have an associate Windows editor for your Java file.
2. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
3. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
4. A Notepad or WordPad window will open with the Java file.
5. Close the opened file.
6. Go back to the Java Perspective and double click on any Java file to open it.
7. Right click on the opened Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
8. Nothing happens, but the Workbench should display a warning message stating that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, indicating that you need to close all files first.
